matchTwissParameters.description: Use twiss parameters computed from the selected beamline

randomSeed.description: The seed for the random number generator for particles

particle.description: The name of particles in the beam.

mass.description: The restmass of the particles in the beam.

charge.description: The electrical charge of the particles in the beam in units of the proton charge

gamma.description: Relativistic factor, ie the ratio between total energy and rest energy of the particles.

beta.description: Ratio between the speed of the particles and the speed of light.

sequence.description: Attaches the beam command to a specific sequence.

kbunch.description: The number of particle bunches in the machine.

npart.description: The number of particles per bunch.

bunched.description: The beam is treated as bunched whenever this makes sense.

radiate.description: Synchrotron radiation is considered in all bipolar magnets.

bv.description: The direction of the particle movement in a beam line.

file.description: The named file is read until a RETURN statement is encountered, or until the EOF.

sequence.description: Sequence for which the constraint applies

range.description: Position where the constraint must be satisfied

dx.description: The misalignment in the x-direction for the entry of the beam element.

dy.description: The misalignment in the y-direction for the entry of the beam element.

ds.description: The misalignment in the s-direction for the entry of the beam element.

dtheta.description: The rotation around the y-axis according to the right hand rule.

dpsi.description: The rotation around the s-axis according to the right hand rule.

mrex.description: The horizontal read error for a monitor. This is ignored if the element is not a monitor.

mrey.description: The vertical read error for a monitor. This is ignored if the element is not a monitor.

mscalx.description: The relative horizontal scaling error for a monitor. This is ignored if the element is not a monitor.

mscaly.description: The relative vertical scaling error for a monitor. This is ignored if the element is not a monitor.

arex.description: The misalignment in the x-direction for the entry of an aperture limit.

arey.description: The misalignment in the y-direction for the entry of an aperture limit.

tol.description: The tolerance attribute is for the distinction between static and dynamic cases: if for the eigenvalues of the one-turn matrix, |e_val_5| <tol and |e_val_6| <tol, then the longitudinal motion is not considered, otherwise it is.

sequence.description: The name of the sequence on which to operate the matching.

q1.description: Enable a correction of tunes in presence of magnetic imperfections or misalignments.

q2.description: Enable a correction of tunes in presence of magnetic imperfections or misalignments.

dq1.description: Enable a correction of chromaticities in presence of magnetic imperfections or misalignments.

dq2.description: Enable a correction of chromaticities in presence of magnetic imperfections or misalignments.

calls.description: Maximum number of calls to the penalty function

repeat.description: The number of calls of the JACOBIAN routine.

strategy.description: Selects the maximum number of iteration used to determine the step length which reduces the penalty function during the main iteration. A large number (i.e. 6) reduces the probability to diverge from the solution, but increases the probability of being trapped in a local minimum.

calls.description: Maximum number of calls to the penalty function

sequence.description: The name of the sequence to be processed to thin slices.

style.description: The slicing style to be used for all elements.

makedipedge.description: A logical flag to control the generation of DIPEDGE elements at the start and/or end of bending magnets, to conserve edge focusing from pole face angles E1, E2 or extra fields described by FINT, FINTX, in the process of slicing bending magnets to thin multipole slices.

deltap.description: Difference between the reference momentum and the design momentum, divided by the design momentum.

calls.description: Maximum number of calls to the penalty function

strategy.description: Specifies the strategy to be used

bborbit.description: The closed orbit is modified by beam-beam kicks

echo.description: Echoes the input on the standard output file

echomacro.description: Issues macro expansion printout for debugging

no_fatal_stop.description: Prevents madx from stopping in case of a fatal error

rbarc.description: Converts the RBEND straight length into the arc length

reset.description: Resets all options to their defaults

sympl.description: All element matrices are symplectified in Twiss

tell.description: Prints the current value of all options

threader.description: Enables the threader for closed orbit finding in Twiss

trace.description: Prints the system time after each command

twiss_print.description: Controls whether the twiss command produces output

verify.description: Issues a warning if an undefined variable is used

errors_out.description: Write out multiple errors in EFCOMP table format

even.description: Even number of splits when using RESPLIT

exact.description: If true exact Hamiltonian is used

magnet_name.description: Magnet names to be used for error write out

offset_deltap.description: Relative momentum deviation of the reference particle.

time.description: Which coordinate system to use depending on 5D or 6D calculation.

ntpsa.description: Invokes the Differential Algebra (DA) package written in C++ and kindly provided by Lingyun Yang (lyyang@lbl.gov). Etienne Forest has written the wrapper to allow the use of both the legendary DA package written in Fortran by Martin Berz (default) and this new DA package of Lingyun Yang. It is expected that this DA package will allow for the efficient calculation of a large number of DA parameters.

sector_nmul.description: A global variable in PTC needed for exact sector bends defining up to which order the multipole are included in solving Maxwell’s equation up to order SECTOR_NMUL_MAX. Multipoles of order N with N > SECTOR_NMUL and N <= SECTOR_NMUL_MAX are treated similar to SixTrack. If a negative value of SECTOR_NMUL_MAX is passed than it is also identified automatically. However, if multipolar parameters of the bends are to be modified inside the PTC universe, for example with PTC_READ_ERRORS, than this parameter needs to be set to a corresponding value. Please note that using large values (above 10) slows down the computations, so the smallest required value should be used.

sector_nmul_max.description: A global variable in PTC needed for exact sector bends defining up to which order Maxwell’s equation are solved. The value of SECTOR_NMUL_MAX must not be smaller than SECTOR_NMUL otherwise MAD-X stops with an error. If a negative value is passed than it is identified automatically by scanning the currently selected sequence.

symprint.description: A flag to enable the printing of the check of symplecticity. It is recommended to leave this flag set to TRUE.

closed_orbit.description: Turn on the closed orbit calculation.

deltap.description: Relative momentum offset for reference closed orbit

map_table.description: Turn on the map-table in memory

normal.description: Turn on the calculation of the Normal Form

table.description: The name of the table where values should be stored.

column.description: The name of the column in the table where values should be stored.

polynomial.description: Specifies the row of the map.

monomial.description: A string composed of digits that defines the monomials of the polynomial in PTC nomenclature. The length of the string should be equal to the number of variables and each digit corresponds to the exponent of the corresponding variable.

parametric.description: If true, and if any knobs is defined, the map element is stored as the parametric result.

debuglevel.description: Sets the level of debugging printout: 0 prints none, 4 prints everything

totalpath.description: If true, the 6th variable of PTC, i.e. 5th of MAD-X, is the total path. If false it is deviation from the reference particle, which is normally the closed orbit for closed layouts. This switch changes behaviour of the RF cavities, including RF multipoles and crab cavities.

radiation.description: Sets the radiation switch/internal state of PTC. In PTC basically all the elements radiate including sextupoles, solenoids and orbit correctors.

envelope.description: Sets the envelope switch/internal state of PTC. It allows to calculate dumping due to radiation and stochastic effects. Warning: this makes the tracking approximately twice slower, so low order should be used.

stochastic.description: Sets the stochastic switch/internal state of PTC. It enables stochastic emission of photons in ray tracking, it only affects PTC_TRACK and PTC_TRACKLINE. The emission is calculated during map tracking therefore PTC_TWISS or PTC_NORMAL needs to be invoked before launching the tracking (also with RADIATION, ENVELOPE and STOCHASTIC set to true). Every tracked ray will receive the same stochastic kicks.

modulation.description: Sets the modulation switch/internal state of PTC. It needs to be set to true to observe effect of AD dipoles.

fringe.description: Sets the fringe switch/internal state of PTC.

beam_envelope.description: Turn on the calculations of the beam envelope with PTC

closed_orbit.description: Turn on the closed orbit calculation

deltap.description: Relative momentum offset for reference closed orbit (used for 5D case ONLY)

element_by_element.description: Switch from the default turn-by-turn tracking to the element-by-element tracking

file.description: The name of the file output will be written to

ffile.description: Printing coordinates after every FFILE turns

icase.description: User-defined dimensionality of the phase-space (4, 5 or 6)

maxaper.description: Upper limits for the particle coordinates

norm_out.description: Transform canonical variables to action-angle variables

radiation.description: Turn on the synchrotron radiation calculated by an internal procedure of PTC

radiation_energy_loss.description: Adds the energy loss for radiation_model1

radiation_model1.description: Turn on the radiation according to the method given in the Ref

recloss.description: Create in memory a table named ”trackloss” containing the coordinates of lost particles.

space_charge.description: Turn on the simulations of the space charge forces between particles

turns.description: Number of turns to be tracked
Number of turns to be tracked. If the layout of the machine is not closed, this value is forced to TURNS=1 by PTC

everystep.description: a logical switch to activate the recording of track parameters at every integration step. Normally tracking data are stored internally only at the end of each element. EVERYSTEP provides the user with finer data points. It implies usage of the so called node (thin) layout.

gcs.description: A logical switch to store track parameters in Global Coordinate System - normally it starts at the entrance face of the first element.

beta0.description: The name of a BETA0 block containing the Twiss parameters to be used as input

closed_orbit.description: trigger the closed orbit calculation (applies to periodic solution ONLY)

deltap.description: relative momentum offset for reference closed orbit

deltap_dependency.description: trigger the computation of the Twiss and dispersion derivatives.

file.description: The name of the file TWISS output will be written to

icase.description: the dimensionality of the phase-space (4, 5 or 6)

ignore_map_orbit.description: ignore the orbit in the map and use the closed orbit instead if requested, or the orbit defined by the starting point specified with X, PX, Y, P, T, DT parameters otherwise.

initial_map_manual.description: trigger the use of an input map stored beforehand in file ”fort.18”, e.g. by a previous initial run of PTC_NORMAL).

initial_matrix_manual.description: trigger the use of the input variables RE11, ...,RE66 as the transfer matrix.

normal.description: saving of the normal form analysis results (the closed solution) into dedicated table called NONLIN. It is the same as ptc_normal. However, the nonlin table has format such that its coefficients can be accessed within the MADX script using table command. This permits, for example, to perform matching of these parameters or or value extraction to a variable. Also, all available orders are calculated and no select_ptc_normal is required. Currently the following parameters are calculated: tunes (and all their derivatives), dipsersions (and all their derivatives), eigen values, transfer map, resonance driving terms (generating function) and the pseudo Hamiltonian. If radiation and envelope is switched on with PTC_SETSWITCH then damping decrements, equilibrium emittances and beam sizes are calculated. Attention: the results are always the plain polynomial coefficients, which is different from ptc_normal nomenclature for some variables, which in turn always gives values of the partial derivatives. Therefore, in order to obtain values of the partial derivatives the respective factorials and binomial coefficients need to be factored out by the user.

pt.description: Energy difference, divided by the reference momentum times the velocity of light.

range.description: The TWISS calculation is restricted to the specified range.

slice_magnets.description: activate the evaluation of Twiss parameters at each integration step inside magnets, in addition to the end face. The number of slices is determined by the number of steps (NST) that can be separately defined for each element, or otherwise set by NST parameter when creating the PTC layout. Note that the orbit rms calculated in this mode counts as valid data points both the end of the previous element and the entrance of the current element. Since the first integration node is always at the entrance of the magnet (after position offset and fringe effects are calculated) which corresponds to the same s position (and usually optical functions) as the end of the previous element, the points at the interface between magnets are included twice in the rms calculation.

t.description: Velocity of light times the negative time difference with respect to the reference particle. A positive T means that the particle arrives ahead of the reference particle.

trackrdts.description: tracking of Resonance Driving Terms (RDTs). For each element all RDTs from order 3 up to value defined by switch NO are saved in TWISSRDT table. This table contains also auxiliary columns as s position, element names, strengths and lengths such that RDT values can be plotted the same way as values from TWISS table. RDTs are elements of the generating function (GFN) of the normalization transformation and for compatibility with PTC_NORMAL notation the columns are prefixed with GNF. Because they are complex numbers 3 values are saved: real part (GNFC), imaginary part (GNFS) and amplitude (GNFA).

class.description: The class of elements to be selected.

clear.description: Deselects ALL positions in the sequence for the flag ”name”.

flag.description: Determines the applicability of the SELECT statement.

full.description: The default for the MAKETHIN flag and for tables

pattern.description: The regular expression pattern for the element names to be selected.

range.description: The range of elements to be selected.

sequence.description: The name of a sequence to which the selection is applied.

slice.description: The number of slices into which the selected elements have to be cut. Only used by MAKETHIN and FLAG=INTERPOLATE

thick.description: Indicate whether the selected elements are treated as thick elements by the MAKETHIN command.

format.description: Format output. Must double-quote each format.

command.description: Print the command with the values of all its parameters.

detune.description: If true, the detune subroutine is executed

distort1.description: If true, the distort1 subroutine is executed

distort2.description: If true, the distort2 subroutine is executed

multipole_order_range.description: Longitudinal interval of the beam line (in m)

noprint.description: If true, no file or internal table will be created to keep the results

nosixtrack.description: If true, the input file fc.34 will not be generated internally by invoking the conversion routine of sixtrack and the user should provide it before the execution of the sodd command

print_all.description: If true, the files and internal tables containing results at each multipole will be generated

print_at_end.description: If true, the files and internal tables containing results at the end of the position range will be generated

start_stop.description: Longitudinal interval of the beam line (in m)

tolerance.description: the tolerance for the numerical integrator DGAUSS

file.description: The name of the output file

beta0.description: The name of a BETA0 block containing the Twiss parameters to be used as input

centre.description: Enforce the calculation of the linear lattice functions at the center of the element instead of the end of the element.

chrom.description: A logical flag to trigger computation of the chromatic functions as well as the radiation synchrotron integrals.

deltap.description: Difference between the reference momentum and the design momentum, divided by the design momentum.

file.description: The name of the file TWISS output will be written to

keeporbit.description: Store the orbit under this name at the start, and at all monitors.

line.description: Name of a valid beamline for which the calculation of optical functions should be performed.

pt.description: Energy difference, divided by the reference momentum times the velocity of light.

range.description: The TWISS calculation is restricted to the specified range.

rmatrix.description: If this flag is used the the one-turn map at the location of every element is calculated and prepared for storage in the twiss table.

sectoracc.description: Save composition of maps instead of individual maps of a sector map.

sectorfile.description: Name of the file to which the SECTORMAP is written.

sectormap.description: Initiate the calculation of a sector map.

sectorpure.description: Save the transfer map Rij without effects from higher order map (Tijk).

sectortable.description: Name of the table containing the SECTORMAP values.

sequence.description: Name of a valid sequence for which the calculation of optical functions should be performed.

t.description: Velocity of light times the negative time difference with respect to the reference particle. A positive T means that the particle arrives ahead of the reference particle.

tolerance.description: The maximum closed orbit error, for all six orbit components, that can be tolerated during the closed orbit search. The value given in the TWISS command is only valid for the current calculation; the COGUESS command allows to change the default value for all subsequent closed orbit search calculations.

useorbit.description: Use the start value provided for the closed orbit search.

sequence.description: Name of the sequence to be loaded and expanded.

period.description: Name of the sequence to be loaded and expanded.

name.description: Name of the parameter or attribute to be varied

step.description: Approximate initial step size for varying the parameter

sigx.description: The horizontal extent of the opposite beam.

sigy.description: The vertical extent of the opposite beam.

xma.description: The horizontal displacement of the opposite beam with respect to the ideal orbit.

yma.description: The vertical displacement of the opposite beam with respect to the ideal orbit.

charge.description: The charge of particles in the opposite beam in elementary charges.

bbshape.description: The parameter to choose the radial density shape of the opposite beam.

width.description: The relative extent of the edge region.

bbdir.description: The direction of motion of the opposite beam relative to the beam considered.

rv1.description: Number of initial turns with zero voltage.

rv2.description: Number of turns to ramp voltage from zero to nominal.

rv3.description: Number of turns with nominal voltage.

rv4.description: Number of turns to ramp voltage from nominal to zero.

rph1.description: Number of initial turns with nominal phase.

rph2.description: Number of turns to ramp phase [2$\pi$] from nominal to specified value.

lagf.description: Value of the final crab RF phase lag

e1.description: The rotation angle for the pole face.

hgap.description: Half gap height of the associated SBEND

tilt.description: The roll angle about the longitudinal axis.
The roll angle about the longitudinal axis.

l.description: The length of the closed orbit corrector.

tilt.description: The roll angle about the longitudinal axis.

l.description: The length of the closed orbit corrector.

tilt.description: The roll angle about the longitudinal axis.

kick1.description: Defines the kick of the element acting on the six phase space coordinates.

kick6.description: Defines the kick of the element acting on the six phase space coordinates.

rm66.description: Defines the linear transfer matrix of the element.

tm111.description: Defines the second-order terms of the element

tm666.description: Defines the second-order terms of the element

thick.description: If this logical flag is set to true the quadrupole is tracked through as a thick-element, instead of being converted into thin-lenses.

fint.description: The fringe field integral at the entrance and exit of the bend.

fintx.description: If defined and positive, the fringe field integral at the exit of the element, overriding FINT for the exit.

h1.description: The curvature of the entrance pole face.
